subject: Re: [junit] Stack overflow crashes GUI test runners
msgSnippet: ????? Kind of sounds like a non-issue.  Fix the stack overflows. ;) -Eric ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Yahoo! Sports -
messageBody:
?????

Kind of sounds like a non-issue. Fix the stack
overflows. ;)

-Eric

--- Theodore Norvell <theo@...> wrote:
> Why is it that if two tests overflow the stack, the
> AWT and Swing test runners crash? Surely this is
> a bug. Here is an example that causes a crash:
>
> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class IsItABug2 extends TestCase {
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite= new TestSuite("Is it a bug
> 2?");
> suite.addTestSuite(IsItABug2.class);
> suite.addTestSuite(IsItABug2.class);
> return suite ; }
>
> public IsItABug2( String name ) { super(name) ;
> }
>
> public void testInfRecursion() {
> infiniteRecursion() ; }
>
> private void infiniteRecursion() {
> infiniteRecursion() ; }
> }
>
> I'm using JDK 1.3.1 and JUnit 3.7.
>
> Cheers,
> Theodore Norvell
>
> ----------------------------
> Dr. Theodore Norvell
> theo@...
> Electrical and Computer Engineering
> http://www.engr.mun.ca/~theo

> contact details.
